title: Mission Description
content: This journey of reflection has finally led to this moment. Looking at the silhouette up ahead, no one can imagine what he is thinking.

speaker: Welt
line: Is this place also affected by the Order ?

speaker: Sunday
line: No, I'm just here to bid farewell. I changed my mind along the way. This journey has too many variables...

speaker: Sunday
line: So it shouldn't matter if we add another.

speaker: Welt
line: How did you know she would be here?

speaker: Sunday
line: I didn't. I had a hunch and decided to try my luck. It seems I can be lucky sometimes.

speaker: Welt
line: It's not like you to leave things to luck.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm trying to change, too.

speaker: Welt
line: I don't think you need a bystander in this scenario. Go on ahead.

speaker: Sunday
line: You're not worried I'll take the opportunity to escape?

speaker: Welt
line: I believe you're the kind of person that has the ability and desire to use everything to your advantage... but that "everything" does not include Miss Robin.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Thank you.

speaker: Welt
line: Now then, Mr. Wonweek...

speaker: Wonweek
line: I'm not leaving. No way.

speaker: Sunday
line: Let him stay. He won't be in the way.

speaker: Sunday
line: I actually need Wonweek to be there. She shouldn't be seen talking to a fugitive no matter the circumstances.

speaker: Welt
line: You... don't intend to reveal your true identity to her?

speaker: Sunday
line: Both parties don't have to be aware that this is a farewell.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...I shouldn't put her at risk for my selfishness.

speaker: Welt
line: ...As you wish.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Shall we go then?

speaker: Sunday
line: (deep breath)...

speaker: Sunday
line: Let's go. Our journey can't begin if I can't take this first step.

title: Step Description
content: Farewells are truly a miraculous thing... No matter how much you've experienced it in your life, it's not something you ever get used to. But that is okay. Without farewells, we would never have reunions to look forward to.Say farewell to your little sister. Take your time... A long and valuable... farewell.

speaker: Welt
line: I don't think you need a bystander in this scenario. Go on ahead.

speaker: Sunday
line: I didn't expect to see you here, Miss Robin.

speaker: Robin
line: It's nice to meet you, Miss. May I know your name?

speaker: Sunday
line: My name is... Wonweek. I'm a member of the Nightingale Family .

speaker: Robin
line: Oh, you're a Dreamweaver. Thank you for all your hard work. You all are the reason the Dreamscape has been able to recover from this crisis.

speaker: Sunday
line: You're too kind, Miss Robin. You must be very busy. What brings you here to Dream's Edge?

speaker: Robin
line: I'm taking a break. I wanted to find a quiet place to relax, ideally somewhere where I could see the stars. Before I knew it, I'd walked all the way here.

speaker: Robin
line: I know these stars only exist in the dream but...

speaker: Sunday
line: Well, perhaps the dreamscape is not so different from reality.

speaker: Sunday
line: "When we look up into the night sky, the stars aren't really there. The glimmering lights we see are merely the images of stars from long ago."

speaker: Sunday
line: So, have we ever truly seen a real sky full of stars?

speaker: Robin
line: You're very philosophical, Miss Wonweek. You remind me of someone I know.

speaker: Robin
line: Do you work nearby?

speaker: Sunday
line: No, no. Today is my rest day. There's going to be a show later, so I came early to find a good seat.

speaker: Robin
line: A show? Here?

speaker: Sunday
line: It's somewhere farther away. They say it's a farewell performance, the kind that's better to listen to from afar than watch it performed live.

speaker: Robin
line: I see. In that case, the observation deck is a good choice. You can see all of Penacony from here.

speaker: Robin
line: Distance can make some things appear more beautiful.

speaker: Sunday
line: Miss Robin, may I stay here with you to gaze at the stars, before the show begins?

speaker: Robin
line: Of course! You don't have to be so courteous. I should be the one asking. This is Dream's Edge, after all, and the Dreamweavers are its true masters.

speaker: Sunday
line: Still, these stars are unfamiliar to me. I don't recognize any of them, and it makes me feel uneasy.

speaker: Robin
line: What makes you feel this way? Is it because the sky is so far away, or because it's the unknown?

speaker: Sunday
line: Perhaps it's both.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Stellaron Disaster may not have had any real consequences, but many guests still chose to check out. Now, the hotel feels quieter than before. It makes me wonder what Penacony's future will be like. I just hope it will not negatively affect you, Miss Robin.

speaker: Robin
line: You're too kind. I'll be fine. The disaster was unexpected, but because of it, I was able to witness many pasts and think about many futures.

speaker: Robin
line: My only real regret is that I left some things unsaid.

speaker: Sunday
line: Did the person you wanted to say them to leave?

speaker: Robin
line: Yes. He left in such a hurry that I didn't even get the chance to say goodbye.

speaker: Sunday
line: Sometimes what's in your heart doesn't need to be dressed up in words. Maybe he already knows what you wanted to say.

speaker: Robin
line: But don't you think we should put in some effort when we want to encourage someone?

speaker: Sunday
line: If you don't mind me asking, who is it that you wish to encourage?

speaker: Robin
line: It's someone who experienced failure recently and is about to embark on a long journey.

speaker: Sunday
line: There are many such people on Penacony. Failure is like the setting sun to a Dreamchaser. It's something that happens every day.

speaker: Sunday
line: I believe they all have the willpower to start anew, especially after receiving a smile from you, Miss Robin.

speaker: Robin
line: But he's different. He's stronger than most ordinary people, but because of it, people have this misconception: They think that when he falls, he will stand back up faster than anyone else.

speaker: Sunday
line: Are you saying that's not true?

speaker: Robin
line: It's not. Because before he stands up again, he will hesitate and agonize for ages over whether that is the right course of action.

speaker: Sunday
line: Failure may be a good thing for someone like that. Being able to reflect on one's actions is a valuable quality to have.

speaker: Robin
line: You may be right, but I still hope that he'll never change.

speaker: Sunday
line: Why's that?

speaker: Robin
line: Because I have faith in the person I remember him to be.

speaker: Robin
line: He may have taken the wrong approach when he failed, but I don't think he had the wrong intentions. We once stood together at the same starting line, but now it's his turn to fly for the stars. I believe he'll find the right path, even if he has to do it alone.

speaker: Robin
line: We don't have to soar into the sky together.

speaker: Robin
line: Because I know we'll reunite one day, up there in the clouds.

speaker: Sunday
line: I hope so.

speaker: Robin
line: Miss Wonweek, may I ask a favor? There's a jigsaw here I'd like to finish before I leave.

speaker: Robin
line: If I have a Dreamweaver's help, maybe I'll be able to fill in the missing pieces.

speaker: Sunday
line: A Dream Jigsaw? I see. I'll do my best.

speaker: Robin
line: Don't worry if you can't find them. Just think of it as us taking a walk together.

text: Help Robin find the jigsaw piece

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm still inexperienced, so let's just hope we get lucky.

speaker: Robin
line: Thank you anyway. I expect the first jigsaw piece will be a part of the starry sky.

speaker: Robin
line: As for the other piece, I hope it will symbolize wings.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Oh, Miss Robin! I'm a big fan!

speaker: Wonweek
line: I don't get to attend every single one of your concerts, but I watch the recordings of each of them at least once. I love all of your songs! Gosh, I wish I could tell the whole world about this!

speaker: Robin
line: Thank you for your support. I'll keep doing my best.

speaker: Sunday
line: It seems we've been blessed with good fortune today.

speaker: Robin
line: Is this...

text: A scrawled note was left here.

speaker: Robin
line: It seems familiar...

speaker: Sunday
line: Another Dreamweaver probably left this behind. It's a habit for this profession. They hope to use these blessings as a foundation for the Dreamscape.

speaker: Sunday
line: The second jigsaw piece. Is this a pair of wings, or a decoration made of feathers?

speaker: Robin
line: Maybe it's somewhere in between the two. It's a pair of broken wings.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...We should keep looking.

speaker: Robin
line: It's okay. Let's use this one.

text: Just as before, a note was placed carefully next to the puzzle, like someone got here a step earlier...
"One more thing, staying fit is important, but don't forget to eat well, too."
Complete the Dream Jigsaw with Robin

speaker: Robin
line: We have enough. Let's go back.

speaker: Sunday
line: It's done. Have a look.

text: That painting feels like a blessing, and also seems to mirror someone's resolve: Even when the broken wings no longer belong to the sky, the direction in which they fall will still be towards the stars—
Media:Trailblaze Mission Sound of Farewell Hums Reunion.mp4
▶ "Soon, I shall travel to those unfamiliar stars, none of which I recognize."
▶ "But as long as you continue to gaze upon them from here—"
▶ "Then those unfamiliar stars will one day be the place of our reunion."

speaker: Robin
line: You still couldn't bear to say goodbye in the end? Maybe I'm stronger than you think...

speaker: Robin
line: You must try to relax on your long journey...

speaker: Robin
line: ...Brother.

speaker: Welt
line: That didn't seem like a perfect goodbye.

speaker: Sunday
line: It's enough. I only meant to stay quietly by her side for a bit.

speaker: Sunday
line: But why did you do those unnecessary things?

speaker: Wonweek
line: What things?

speaker: Sunday
line: Those two notes. If someone finds them, they can be used as evidence against her.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hmph, so you can do whatever you want as many times as you want, but I can't?

speaker: Wonweek
line: I don't want to live with regret for the rest of my life either.

speaker: Welt
line: Live with regret...

speaker: Wonweek
line: We're almost done saying our goodbyes, right?

speaker: Sunday
line: Yes, we only have one last stop.

speaker: Sunday
line: But before we leave, I have a question I'd like to ask you, Mr. Yang.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm curious. Why did you become a Nameless ?

speaker: Welt
line: Why the sudden interest?

speaker: Sunday
line: I always had a feeling that you would never give up on someone who needed help. After spending time with you, I'm even more convinced of this assessment.

speaker: Sunday
line: At this very moment, there are countless worlds above the skies still waiting for the arrival of the Astral Express , yet you and your companions have chosen to stay here. All for an "old friend" you never knew and a notorious fugitive.

speaker: Sunday
line: To Trailblaze means to forge ahead, yet you stop and spend precious time on people just passing by. All the while you believe this is... the natural course of action?

speaker: Welt
line: That's not what I think at all. Besides, the Watchmaker also made a similar choice.

speaker: Sunday
line: And because of that, he bid farewell to the Express and never walked among the stars again in his lifetime.

speaker: Welt
line: "Not all journeys lead to the stars." Even if we leave the Express, some Trailblazing paths will still continue.

speaker: Welt
line: You can think of it this way: The title of Nameless doesn't belong to any one person. Each individual will have their own view of what it means to walk this path, and will always try their best, no matter the situation.

speaker: Welt
line: The goal of my Trailblazing is not the unknown world, but every living being who exists under the stars.

speaker: Welt
line: In my homeland, the name "Welt" means "world." It suggests that each person is a world unto themselves, and that we harbor as many possibilities as the distant stars. The connections I gain on my journey are what is most precious to me.

speaker: Welt
line: This is my way of the Trailblaze and the reason why I decided to stay here.

speaker: Sunday
line: Why me?

speaker: Welt
line: Like I said before, I left my home in a hurry, too. I know how you feel right now.

speaker: Welt
line: I also know that a person will only be able to truly face themselves once they've decided to say goodbye to their past... the same way you're doing right here, right now...

speaker: Welt
line: There was never a third person with us, was there?

speaker: Wonweek
line: I told you he'd find out.

speaker: Sunday
line: I should have known nothing could escape your keen eyes.

speaker: Sunday
line: Since you already know Wonweek's secret, there's no need for me to build up suspense.

speaker: Sunday
line: Let's go. We'll head straight for the finale and take our final bow in this farewell performance.

title: Step Description
content: Only when one has fallen to the ground can they learn how to fly. If one wants to take a curtain call, they must stand on the stage once more.Go to Penacony Grand Theater and complete the final step of this farewell.

children.text:
(EnterExploratory ExcursionPenacony Grand Theater)
(Begin sub-missionBow Out At Moment of Début)
